channel.title: Resident Evil
channel.description: I thought that maybe there's few ppl in RSC section that likes RE series?

item.title: Resident Evil
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

I played the ORC through, it was pretty fun, but the story mode felt like they abandoned the project half way done, and created a ending fast so they could publish the game. Heck, when the game ended, I felt like the game just actually started.

The multiplayer is very laggy, might be because of the hosts, there’s no way to monitor your ping but I’d say it’s always around 400ms.

  • Menu music
  • Raccoon City
  • Zombies
  • Graphics
    -Felt like a half-assed project.
    -Multiplayer is laggy
    -You can’t play with survivors in story mode.
    -The bots are really retarded

There’s probably more good and bad sides, but it’s not worth my time making bigger list.

I’d give it a 2/5, it’s not worth buying.

Read full topic

[quote=“nacional, post:26, topic:436906”]ah i see, I should do better since my specs are bit higher end. Man you gotta love dolphin, bring hd to the wii.
I hope the wii u can step it up. btw thanks for the detailed explanation rep.[/quote]
Yeah well, you can’t really play it with higher fps than 30 like I said, so it doesn’t really matter, I’ve seen ridiculous specs running it as good as I am, talking about C2D 1.8GHz, 8600GT, 2GB.
Btw. I’ve almost finished RE:Remake, I’m at the lab part.

item.title: Resident Evil
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“nacional, post:24, topic:436906”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=539620.msg3954598#msg3954598 date=1332625042]
I just got RE:Remake working flawlessy on Dolphin GC/Wii emulator with DS3 controller, I’ve played it till the counteryard, it wasn’t that scary at all anymore, but I enjoyed playing it a lot. Going to play it again tomorrow, if anybody is interested about the emulator PM me or just google it.
[/quote]

how much fps are you getting around?
some games are just crappy on dolphin unless you really tweak it[/quote]
I’m getting 30 FPS as I locked it to that, if it goes over that the game will ‘fast forward’ as in things speed up as if you were using speedhack, last time I played RE with Dolphin I hardly got 15 FPS. I’m pretty sure GC/Wii plays the RE games at 30 FPS aswell, because it looks exactly same and is just as smooth as you would play on the real console, while I was playing I actually forgot that I’m playing on PC lol. There’s a thread on dolphin forums for each game where you can see the correct settings so the game will run smoothly. Only thing I’ve noticed while I was playing that BGM doesn’t play sometimes and it sometimes has small breaks before looping the BGM again.

My PC’s specs:

Operating System: Windows 7 32-bit Processor/CPU: AMD Athlon II X4 645 @ 3.10GHz Video Card/GPU: AMD Radeon 6670 Memory/RAM: 4GB DDR3 Dolphin Revision Currently Using: Dolphin-win-x86-r7613

Graphic settings:

Resolution: 1400x900
Backend: Direct3D9
Internal Resolution: Auto(Multiple of 640x528)
AA: 4xSSAA
AF: 16x

Picture of how it looks with those settings:

73mj3p.png1440×900

Read full topic

item.title: Resident Evil
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“DealingRocks, post:15, topic:436906”]Some of you mentioned not liking the new “shooter” style of RE4/RE5. I heard/read somewhere that RE6 is going to allow you to choose between the “classic” (story line oriented) and “shooter” (shoot 'em up) styles by which character you choose to play as.

If this is the case, RE6 may be the first RE I buy since RE2.[/quote]
Wow… Thanks for the info, if that classic mode is avaible, I will definetly buy that game.

I hope that classic mode doesn’t mean that the view will be same as on the old games, because what I’ve been dreaming of for a while is RE with the shoulder view and the classic gameplay where you have to think twice before shooting enemies, so you don’t run out of bullets, and which is also scary.

I haven’t really read anything about RE6 yet, but by watching the trailer I can tell that there’s the old good zombies and extremely good graphics, I’m wondering where the game takes it’s place on. It can’t be raccoon city unless it’s been rebuild after the nuke.

EDIT: It seems that RE6 is directed by Hiroyuki Kobayash, which was involved in making RE0, RE1, RE2 and RE4 just by that we know what to expect from the RE6.

Read full topic
